# adjustScroll(_:)

**Instance Method**

Overridden by subclasses to modify a given rectangle, returning the altered rectangle.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func adjustScroll(_ newVisible: NSRect) -> NSRect
```

## Parameters

- **newVisible**: A rectangle that defines a region of the view.

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] invokes this method to allow its document view to adjust its position during scrolling. For example, a custom view object that displays a table of data can adjust the origin of `newVisible` so rows or columns aren’t cut off by the edge of the enclosing [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView]. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView] implementation simply returns `newVisible`.

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] only invokes this method during automatic or user controlled scrolling. Its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView/scroll(to:)] method doesn’t invoke this method, so you can still force a scroll to an arbitrary point.

## Scrolling the View

- **prepareContent(in:)**: Prepares the overdraw region for drawing.
- **preparedContentRect**: The portion of the view that has been rendered and is available for responsive scrolling.
- **scroll(_:)**: Scrolls the view’s closest ancestor [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] object so a point in the view lies at the origin of the clip view’s bounds rectangle.
- **scrollToVisible(_:)**: Scrolls the view’s closest ancestor [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] object the minimum distance needed so a specified region of the view becomes visible in the clip view.
- **autoscroll(with:)**: Scrolls the view’s closest ancestor [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] object proportionally to the distance of an event that occurs outside of it.
- **enclosingScrollView**: The nearest ancestor scroll view that contains the current view.
- **scroll(_:to:)**: Notifies the superview of a clip view that the clip view needs to reset the origin of its bounds rectangle.
- **reflectScrolledClipView(_:)**: Notifies a clip view’s superview that either the clip view’s bounds rectangle or the document view’s frame rectangle has changed, and that any indicators of the scroll position need to be adjusted.
- **isCompatibleWithResponsiveScrolling**: A Boolean value that indicates whether views support responsive scrolling.
